meanings.definition: Without life or vitality; in a lifeless manner.
meanings.sent1: The abandoned house stood lifelessly on the corner, with no signs of activity.
meanings.sent2: The flowers drooped lifelessly in the scorching sun, lacking their usual vibrancy.
meanings.sent3: The party was so dull that even the music played lifelessly in the background.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes gazed lifelessly into the distance, reflecting a deep sense of emptiness.
meanings.sent5: The old clock ticked lifelessly on the wall, reminding her of the passage of time.

meanings.sent1: The painting looked lifelessly flat, lacking the artist's usual flair.
meanings.sent2: His jokes fell lifelessly on the audience, failing to elicit any laughter.
meanings.sent3: The meeting proceeded lifelessly, with no one showing any enthusiasm for the topic.
meanings.sent4: The once lively street now appeared lifelessly quiet, devoid of its usual hustle and bustle.
meanings.sent5: The story ended lifelessly, leaving the readers disappointed with its lack of excitement.
